laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial fracture alignment was acceptable; 5° varus deformity of the distal part of the right femur; evidence of metaphyseal healing noted.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Bilateral range-of-motion exercises were initiated three days after surgery; the right distal femoral fracture showed further evidence of metaphyseal healing three months after surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated a femoral nonunion, varus collapse, and implant failure.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased pain and deformity reported nine months after initial surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No knee pain and flexion from 0° to 115°, indicating healed nonunion.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Nonunions indicated at nine months treated successfully with a revision to a 95° condylar blade plate.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated 115° of flexion of the left knee.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient began progressive weight-bearing four months after surgery.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Fracture appeared healed radiographically, and the patient reported no pain.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 115° of knee flexion at eighteen months postoperatively.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Stable alignment of the fracture; early evidence of healing noted.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive weight-bearing began twelve weeks postoperatively.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated two broken screws at the distal screw-plate interface and 5° of varus collapse.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient reported mild pain and stiffness; decrease in pain over the next ten months with additional healing of the fracture.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated stable alignment of the fracture but showed loosening of one distal screw.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Some early fracture-healing was evident, and progressive weight-bearing was started.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Fracture was healed with improved function.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Knee flexion was from 0° to 110° at twenty months postoperatively.
